definition: to reply to a telegram/to wire back
to circle/to go back/to turn around/to answer/to return/to revolve/Hui ethnic group (Chinese Muslims)/time/classifier for acts of a play/section or chapter (of a classic book)
lightning/electricity/electric (bound form)/to get (or give) an electric shock/phone call or telegram etc/to send via telephone or telegram etc

sentences.english: The U.N. did not return calls seeking comment on the scandal.
sentences.chinese: 聯合國對關於這個質疑沒有回電發表評論。

sentences.english: When unable to call back if they should be entrusted to another agency.
sentences.chinese: 如果自己確實無法親自回電，應託付他人代辦。

sentences.english: B: I'll check the rates and call you back .
sentences.chinese: 我來查一下價目再給你回電。

sentences.english: FERO: Ben will call you back.
Be sure to cable OFDA upon receipt of the requested items.
sentences.chinese: 在收到索要的物資時，確保回電向OFDA報告。

sentences.english: Could you ask him to return my call?
This offer will remain open until receipt of your wire per return.
sentences.chinese: 此盤有效期至收到你方回電爲止。

sentences.english: 'It's like having a second job at night, and you're hoping people call you back.
sentences.chinese: 那就像有一份夜間第二職業，你希望別人給你回電。

sentences.english: The Colorado National Guard did not return a call seeking comment.
sentences.chinese: 科羅拉多州國民兵部隊則對詢問電話沒有回電。

sentences.english: Please wire or telegraph me promptly, if you are interested.
sentences.chinese: 如對這些商品感興趣，請立即回電示告。

sentences.english: You hit the pause button by putting a customer on hold or telling the customer you will call them back.
sentences.chinese: 你可以請客戶稍等或等你的回電來按下“暫停”鍵。

definition: all crows are black (idiom)/evil people are bad all over the world
pinyin: tian1 xia4 wu1 ya1 yi1 ban1 hei1

definition: to make a terrible scene (idiom)/to throw a tantrum
pinyin: yi1 ku1 er4 nao4 san1 shang4 diao4

definition: lit. small belly, chicken's gut (idiom); narrow-minded/petty
to bite the hand that feeds one (idiom)
(idiom) to lose one's head/to panic/to go to pieces
to go around in circles/to make a detour/(fig.) to beat about the bush
extreme benevolence, utmost duty (idiom); meticulous virtue and attention to duty
to follow the path to one's own doom (idiom)/to bring about one's own destruction
weary old body (colloquial term, used jocularly or irreverently)
to drown sb in a wicker basket, a form of 沉潭[chen2 tan2]
please excuse me for not complying/to politely decline
